title: Epic: Adopt hypercerts-scaffold-atproto design language
description:
## Goal
Migrate identitylink to use the exact same design language and visual style as hypercerts-scaffold-atproto.

## What success looks like
- OKLCH-based color system with hue 260 monochromatic neutral palette
- Glass-panel containers with backdrop-blur, noise texture overlay, gradient-mesh backgrounds
- Syne display font for headings, Outfit for body text, Geist as default sans
- shadcn/ui new-york style components (button, card, input, badge, dialog, separator, skeleton, tabs)
- lucide-react icons replacing all inline SVGs
- Entrance animations (fade-in-up, stagger-children)
- create-accent token as the primary CTA color (dark charcoal light mode, light gray dark mode)
- All 5 pages restyled: landing, link wizard, verify, manage, docs
- Build succeeds with no type errors

## Key constraints
- Do NOT change any business logic, API routes, hooks, or lib/ utilities
- Do NOT change wagmi/atproto integration code
- Preserve all existing functionality
- The src/ directory structure stays (don't flatten to app/)
- Package manager is npm (not pnpm)

"use client"
import { ThemeProvider as NextThemesProvider } from "next-themes"
